Package model

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Main class that handles the game. Handles the board, the main loop, the end conditions
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Game

        public Game​(java.lang.String player1,
            java.lang.String player2,
            Mode gameMode)
        class constructor in case both player are human
        Parameters:
        player1 - name of the first player
        player2 - name of the second player
        gameMode - gameMode (for debugging purposes)

            java.lang.String player2,
            Mode gameMode,

        Parameters:
        player1 - name of the first player
        player2 - name of the second player
        gameMode - gameMode (for debugging purposes)
        diff - Difficulty of the Automated player

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        method used to start the game Also the game's main loop

      • end

        public void end​(int n)
        method used to end the game when someone wins n = 0 : a player won n = 1 : the game ended on a tie
        Parameters:
        n - int that decides the end scenario

      • isMovePossible

        public boolean isMovePossible​(Pawn p,
                              int x,
                              int y)
        Checks if the enterd move is possible : 1) Evaluates the Direction by using relatives positions of the pawn and the entended move 2) Checks if there are some enemy pawn on the way
        Parameters:
        p - Pawn to move
        x - x coordinate to move to
        y - y coordinate to move to
        Returns:
        true if the move is possible, false otherwise

      • isWon

        public boolean isWon​(Player p)
        isWon is called to verify if the game was won by the given player
        Parameters:
        p - Player who just played
        Returns:
        true if the player won

      • readMove

        public void readMove()
        readMove reads the players next move (asks for pawn to move, and for the next coordinates). Reapats until move is right, or the player saved the game to quit.

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove​(Pawn p,
                     int x,
                     int y)
        Moves a pawn on the grid
        Parameters:
        p - pawn to move
        x - x Coordinate of where to move the pawn
        y - y Coordinate of where to move the pawn

      • detectChain

        public int detectChain​(Player p)
        Detects the lenght of a chain. Takes the first pawn in the pawnList's order and performs a Depth-First Search to mark every pawn that makes transitively contact with the first one.
        Parameters:
        p - Player to detect the chain of
        Returns:
        the length of the chain

      • nextSon

        public Pawn nextSon​(Pawn s,
                    java.util.ArrayList<Pawn> playerList,
                    boolean[] marked)
        Returns the next unmarked son of a given summit
        Parameters:
        s - summit
        playerList - list of pawns (summits)
        marked - list of marked summits
        Returns:
        a Pawn (next son) or null if there are no unmarked sons

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard()
        setBoard is called once by the constructor, to initialize the board and the pawns

      • getPawnList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Pawn> getPawnList()
        returns the arrayList of Pawns (for testing purposes)
        Returns:
        pawnList attribut

      • getGrid

        public Square[][] getGrid()
        returns the grid (for testing purposes)
        Returns:
        game board

      • getPawnOnSquare

        public Pawn getPawnOnSquare​(int x,
                            int y)
        Gets the pawn on the given square
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the square
        y - y coordinate of the square
        Returns:
        a pawn, or null if the square is empty

      • removePawn

        public void removePawn​(Pawn p)
        Removes a Pawn from pawnList, if this one is taken by the oppponent, and is therefor no longer in game
        Parameters:
        p - Pawn to remove

      • getNbPawn

        public int getNbPawn​(Player p)
        Gets the number of pawn remanining possessed by the player (counting the ZEN pawn) Used to compare to the longuest chain
        Returns:
        nb of pawns remaining (-1 if an error occurs)

      • changePlayer

        public void changePlayer()
        changes the current player to the other player

      • getCurrent

        public Player getCurrent()
        returns the current player (for testing purposes)
        Returns:
        the current player

        public Player getPlayer1()
        returns the player 1 (for testing purposes)
        Returns:
        the player 2
